body_html: I'm getting the same error message (AttrValue must not have reference type value of float_ref), also related to using Variables on the GPU, but unrelated to orthogonal_initializer. I'm not sure what exactly is triggering it, due to the difficulty debugging this error (for the reasons pointed out by @olegklimov). It'd be great if the error in general could be made more informative, not just a a fix for orthogonal_initializer . A stack trace/line number pointing to the code that created the op that's throwing the error would be ideal, but if that isn't possible even just the name of the Op associated with the _Recv node would help.

body: I'm getting the same error message (`AttrValue must not have reference type value of float_ref`), also related to using Variables on the GPU, but unrelated to `orthogonal_initializer`.  I'm not sure what exactly is triggering it, due to the difficulty debugging this error (for the reasons pointed out by @olegklimov).  It'd be great if the error in general could be made more informative, not just a a fix for `orthogonal_initializer` . A stack trace/line number pointing to the code that created the op that's throwing the error would be ideal, but if that isn't possible even just the name of the Op associated with the `_Recv` node would help.
